Name: goferGirl
Overview:
LOCAL BUSINESS SELLS TIME TO BUSY PEOPLE

1st May 2010

Perth, Western Australia – goferGirl, a new business in Perth, has started offering a valuable and innovative service to local individuals and businesses: They will do the things on your to-do list, so that you have more free time in your day.  Called “personal concierges,” goferGirl is a can do specialist, who’s reliable, discreet and can handle any assignment, from grocery shopping to gift buying, to standing in line for your all-time-favourite sporting and event tickets.

There has never been a better time for time-saving services in Perth. The mining boom in Western Australia has seen the time crisis reach new heights.  More and more people are opting to join the FIFO and offshore workers, lured by the lucrative pay packets, but as many will tell you its tough going and trying to get things done back home certainly at times can impose certain challenges.

Sharon Rosevear, owner, of goferGirl, recognized that every person’s time is precious, and decided to start a business that gives people back the gift of time in their busy lives.  “Why spend time waiting in line at the grocery store when you can be at the football, catching up with friends, taking your significant other out for dinner or just relaxing at home for a change?  Everyone could use a little more free time in their lives.”

goferGirl’s many clients agree that relief from time-consuming tasks like getting the car serviced, waiting for contractors to arrive, or buying gifts is a welcome service.

More information about the company is available at www.gofergirl.com.au

Contact: 	Sharon Rosevear, owner, goferGirl
		0420 304 6767
		info@gofergirl.com.au

Name: Box Hill Cemetery

Overview:
Box Hill Cemetery is a Victorian 'B-class' cemetery offering modern interment and commemorative support to bereaved families in the heart of Melbourne’s eastern suburbs. The 12.5 hectares (31 acres) is a sanctuary for the remains of around 50,000 decedents, including several famous Australians.

The cemetery’s cultural and historic values are considered of State significance and the unique 1926 Columbarium and Sidney Myer memorial are listed on the Victorian Heritage Register.

Box Hill Cemetery Trust is responsible to the Government of Victoria for the perpetual care of areas ranging from the late nineteenth-century cemetery through twentieth-century monumental graves and cremation memorials, to vaults, a contemporary mausoleum and recent memorial gardens.

Name: Marriage and Relationship Educators Association of Australia (MAREAA)
Overview:
MAREAA is a national association representing a body of enthusiastic, dynamic and creative marriage and relationship educators.We are committed to encouraging and equipping people to achieve fulfilling relationships.

MAREAA aims to support educators in their ongoing professional development through networking, in service training opportunities, conferences, sharing of resources plus much more. MAREAA has active members in most states and territories, see our state list for more details.

Marriage and Relationship Education is an adult education activity designed to inform and enrich relationships and individuals. Members of this association facilitate programs for individuals, couples, families and groups of all ages. Programs may include preparation for marriage, skills for strengthening relationships, school programs, parenting, stepfamilies, men’s issues, workplace relationships, personal development, conflict management, rebuilding after separation or divorce.

MAREAA formerly the Marriage Educators Association of Australia (MEAA), was constituted in Melbourne in September 1995, to meet the professional needs of marriage and relationship educators throughout Australia.

Name: Dunlea Centre
Location: 35A Waratah Rd, Engadine, Sydney, NSW 2233, AU
Overview:
Dunlea Centre, Australia’s Original Boys’ Town, is a residential, family preservation agency auspiced by the Salesians of Don Bosco. The therapeutic work is focused upon troubled young people and their families who are in crisis and at risk of family breakdown. Through a holistic, wrap around model of service delivery, the Dunlea Centre is able to support and assist families in healing broken bonds and building stronger familial ties. 
 
The program provides a nurturing, individualised learning program, enabling young people to maintain their school education at their own pace and ability. Concurrently, the program provides young people with invaluable life skills experiences including camps and sporting activities. Other activities include skills development through counselling, anger management, conflict resolution, hospitality, personal hygiene and health awareness. This individualised approach provides the foundation from which young people can commence making positive modifications in their lives. It really is “a place for change”.
 
Dunlea Centre is a registered charity that relies on the goodwill and generosity of the community for funding and maintaining its programs.  Donations and bequests that fund these programs make a distinct difference in helping to address the emotional difficulties that many families endure. Your support is a valuable way to give back to the community and help families and young people who are struggling to embrace a better future. 

Don Bosco, the founder of the Salesian order of priests, believed there is ‘no such thing as a bad child’. The provision of patience, gentleness and love are at the heart of the work we do each and every day.  Please support Dunlea Centre by making a contribution to the programs that help troubled young people and their families. Help give these young people and their families an opportunity to make positive changes and build a brighter future.  

www.dunleacentre.org.au

Name: Centennial Park Cemetery
Location: 760 Goodwood Road, Pasadena, South Australia 5042, AU
Overview:
At Centennial Park, we’re proud to provide a beautiful, peaceful and reflective community space for all South Australians—from all cultural backgrounds—to enduringly commemorate their loved ones.

Established in 1936 in the foothills of Adelaide’s inner south, with sweeping views of the city and glimpses of the ocean, our park has long been considered the state’s premier cemetery. Our beautifully landscaped grounds span 40 hectares (100 acres) and include over 30 thoughtfully designed gardens and burial areas, along with three unique chapels in our award-winning Jubilee Complex.

Centennial Park is the resting place of more than 140,000 individuals, including many historic figures, and provides a valuable emotional “anchor point” for their friends and families. We continue to raise community awareness of different ways to mark, and cope with, a loved one’s passing. 
We also regularly stage meaningful community events that respectfully embrace the essence of life—such as art and music, theater, food and more—to strengthen South Australians’ sense of connection to the park, both before and after loss.

Centennial Park is open all year ‘round, and we invite you to experience our tranquil grounds first-hand.

Name: Care to Move Australia
Overview:
Care to Move helps people who are downsizing but don't know where to start. We focus and have experience in retirement and aged care transitions, deceased estates, divorce and separations.

Our team of professionals all have caring backgrounds either in healthcare, project management or transitions.

Retirement relocations
Now you’ve retired the thought of making the move to a new home can feel overwhelming. Care to Move
helps make this lifetime transition easier for you and your entire family.

Aged care relocations
The transition to an aged care facility is often a trying time for families. Care to Move’s professional and compassionate team talks with you about your needs and efficiently coordinates the move for you.

Deceased estates
You may not have the time or emotional strength to manage the preparation and sale of a deceased estate. Care to Move offers an empathetic and professional service, seamlessly managing the process from start to finish.

Separation or divorce
Traditional movers move ‘things’, Care to Move moves people. We provide confidential, reliable and understanding help to divide a household of belongings.

Disability transitions
Everyone moves at some stage of their life. If you need a little extra assistance because of a disability, Care to Move provides a competent, trustworthy and respectful service, taking into account your physical and emotional needs.

We create a personalised plan to:

 declutter and downsize
 organise waste and donations
 find storage and movers
 arrange cleaning and maintenance
 coordinate styling and real estate
 help with settling in and unpacking

We plan, perform and position your move with absolute care, making your new home, feel like home.

We are here to talk about your next steps. Whether it’s a transition, relocation or deceased estate contact us today for an obligation free discussion.

Whatever your situation, we have a professional team to assist with your transition.

Name: IgniteMinds
Overview:
Ignite Mind’s provides quality education and childcare services that is responsive to the needs of the community.  Ignite Minds recognises that early years education and care is pivotal to the development of intelligent, compassionate and well adjusted adults.

‘The Early Years Learning Framework describes the principles, practice and outcomes essential to support and enhance young children’s learning from birth to five years of age, as well as their transition to school.  The Framework has a strong emphasis on play-based learning as play is the best vehicle for young children’s learning providing the most appropriate stimulus for brain development. The Framework also recognises the importance of communication and language (including early literacy and numeracy) and social and emotional development.’  Ignite Minds will utilise this framework through measures of a child’s Belonging, Being and Becoming.

Ignite Minds recognises that not all adults have had ideal early years education and seeks partnerships with adults and educators looking to create viable alternatives for our children.  Ignite Minds values the intellect, imagination and creativity of childhood.  We will Ignite Minds with practical, hands-on activities and environments that encourage creative play for the whole community. Ignite Minds will emphasis artistic expression and social capacities, fostering both creative and analytical modes of understanding.

Name: Signal Flare Inc
Location: PO Box 12507, George Street, QLD 4003, AU
Overview: Signal Flare is a charity that supports the homeless and other marginalized people by inviting the community to work together to providing free clothes, shoes, toiletries, children's toys, non perishable foods and more at their BBQs for the Homeless and Others in Need. Grant Richards or Grant the Polite Guy, as he is affectionately known by many, many people, was still homeless himself when he organised his first BBQ in 2011. He was touched to the core to see four hundred homeless people turn up to receive free food, clothes and toiletries. It inspired him to continue to organise these BBQs on a regular basis. In 2012 Berni Palings, nicknamed Bernie the Polite Girl by Grant, started to help. The BBQs grew, and with a dedicated team around them they founded this charity Signal Flare, which has helped hundreds of homeless and others in need since being established in 2013.At Signal Flare's BBQs, the volunteers find just as much joy and satisfaction at the guests, and the smiles are just as big. Berni Palings, the Director of Signal Flare has been there from the beginning. ‘Our main goals are to help people with a second chance in life, and to promote equality and social inclusion, giving food and basic necessities for free in a very social environment to those who cannot afford them. When we come across those who want to get back on their feet, we like to empower them to turn their lives around.  Our most important mission, however, is to restore self-belief, self-worth and dignity for people who hit hard times. Grant always says, “when you see homeless people and you take out the word “homeless “, all you see is people”. And that is so true. We are all people no matter what our circumstances, so let’s treat each other as such’. If you would like to help support Signal Flare, please visit our website and click on the Donate Now or volunteer by contacting us through Linkedin or on our Facebook page.

Name: Easy Care Gardening Inc
Overview:
Easy Care Gardening Inc is a charitable gardening service for the frail aged and people on a disability pension and their carers. Teams of volunteer gardeners weed, prune, mulch and make gardens safe and tidy and "easy care" so that these people, who can otherwise look after themselves, can remain in their own homes. Easy Care Gardening Inc operates in the Ku-ring-gai, Hornsby, Ryde and Hunters Hill local government areas in Sydney's northern suburbs. Easy Care Gardening was established on 8 August 1988 with just 3 volunteers and a handful of clients. Twenty-five years later there are over 500 volunteers working in the gardens of well over 1,000 mostly elderly clients. 

Volunteers are all ages from late teens to late 80s. Anyone who is fit enough to work is welcome. The work suits recent retirees wanting to make friends and links in their community, parents with school age children and time to spare during the day, people between jobs, students and anyone  who would prefer to keep fit and help others.

Name: Family Aged Care Advocates
Overview: At Family Aged Care Advocates, our reason for being is helping people age with dignity.We are committed to assisting people achieve the aged care outcomes that are right for them without losing their dignity or their way in what can be a very confusing and convoluted process.Family Aged Care Advocates believe that better outcomes are achieved when you get talking early and proactively plan for an aged care journey on your terms.  However, we also understand that in reality many care decisions are made in hospital hallways and carparks after some catastrophe.  We know that this means that there are often compressed timelines and elevated emotions and stress resulting in uncertainty and overwhelm.This is where Family Aged Care Advocates can really help - we are independent and only interested in the right outcome for you … and we know aged care comprehensively.  People don’t know what they don’t know.  We help you get it right first time - saving time, energy and money and keeping the stress contained.Our services are designed to be either a comprehensive module with a supportive post service check-in, or a bundle of services that build as your situation evolves.  There is also the cost effective membership services, whereby you will receive regular monthly support from us to ensure that your needs are being met, this gives you peace-of-mind that you can contact us at any time and we will step in and stand up for you.  Alternatively, we can tailor a package specifically for your needs.Our service offering includes:•	Family Conference•	Falls Risk Assessment•	My Aged Care•	Home Care•	Residential Aged Care•	Centrelink / DVA Authority•	Membership ServicesIf you’re interested to have a chat – please contact us:•	Shane Hayes – 0411 264 002 or email shane@faca.com.au•	Whenua Oner – 0419 122 513 or email whenua@faca.com.au

Name: Foster Care Association of Victoria
Overview: The FCAV‘s mission is to strengthen foster care in Victoria. We are the peak body for foster carers, and represent their voice through our work with government, agencies and the media. Our staff are here to enhance carers’ ability to improve the lives of young people in their care through the provision of support and information, and we are always available for an independent perspective on any questions or concerns you have about foster care.

Name: Parents Beyond Breakup
Overview: Who are we?Parents Beyond Breakup is a national charity working in many communities across Australia and focussing on suicide prevention in one of the most at risk demographics - separating parents.Why do we existEvery child deserves a great relationship with their parents, one that offers them the best possible start in life. We believe all mums and dads want to be the best parents that they can be, and that at times all of us struggle to live up to that expectation. We exist to help separated mums and dads deal with the practical and personal challenges that can get in the way of being the best parents they can be.How do we workWe work to make positive change happen on an individual, cultural and systemic level. We help separated mums and dads to find more effective ways to deal with their situation; we do this through our helpline, local peer support groups and other resources. We work to raise public awareness of the challenges that parents face, and to improve the way the system helps parents contribute to the upbringing of their children.The results Separated parents are connected to a community of support that they need; in doing so we help parents cope with being separated from their children and to find the optimal path to reconnecting them. 7 out of 10 parents that we work with say that we offer the best support that they have been able to find. 2016 Research shows that we helped prevent just under 240 parental suicides; that's children from nearly 240 families, in one year, that will not have lost a much loved parent.

Name: Hunter Homeless Connect
Location: PO Box 3522 , Merewether, Newcastle, New South Wales 2300, AU
Overview:
Hunter Homeless Connect is a volunteer not-for-profit organisation that coordinates the annual Hunter Homeless Connect Day. The day links people to vital services such as accommodation and housing providers, health and wellbeing, legal and financial assistance, employment, study, and support to people who are homeless, doing it tough and at risk of homelessness.

This is delivered in an environment that maintains dignity, fosters a culture of connectedness, and encourages a sense of being a valued member of the community.

Each year since 2009 up to 1,500 guests have been welcomed at the annual Hunter Homeless Connect Day, accessing a one-stop-shop of human and community services, plus receiving free haircuts, massages, immunisations, birth certificates, bedding, phone cards, food, clothing and much more.

The Hunter Homeless Connect Day is delivered by a ‘community coalition’ of government and non-government services and volunteers, with in-kind and financial support from organisations, community partners and individuals across the Hunter.

Name: Refugee Migrant Children Centre (RMCC)
Overview: RMCC tackles the unique and complex barriers faced by school aged children and youth from refugee, asylum seeker and migrant backgrounds that now call Australia home through their settlement journey, so they become empowered individuals that can create their ownopportunities.The RMCC journey started from humble beginnings in 2012 and has evolved to us assisting over 900 kids across multiple programs, and by 2020 our goal is to reach over 2000 kids in need. Name: ConnectAbility
Overview:
ConnectAbility Australia was founded in 1992 by a group of community members and families to meet the needs of people to access community based resources, facilities and services.  
We provide a broad range of personalised supports to older community members, children and young people and people with disabilities. ConnectAbility participants reside throughout Newcastle, Lake Macquarie, Port Stephens, Maitland and other Lower Hunter local government areas.
Our approach is personal, flexible and centred on the person. Whether you are attending one of our Friendship Groups as an older person, a playgroup, community education sessions, or are a person with a disability looking to achieve goals and dreams ConnectAbility will work with you. 
Dependent on your requirements, ConnectAbility can assist people with in-home personal care and domestic assistance, shopping and meal preparation, assistance with medication management, social supports and respite care both in-home and in the community. We look at creating meaningful relationships and true inclusion for people within the community.  There are a number of community education and support  opportunities offered such as language classes, vacation programs for school children, and youth and family counselling.
We actively seek community and corporate supports and partners to further enhance opportunities and outcomes. This could involve skill sharing, donations, staff giving or time for employees to spend in ConnectAbility with those we support. The support we receive from community and corporate partners allows ConnectAbility to directly support and assist more people within the Hunter community giving us stronger and more connected communities.
ConnectAbility Australia is a not for profit incorporated association, and is registered as a gift deductible recipient with tax charity concessions. We are governed by a Board consisting of volunteer community and consumer representatives.

Name: Doncare
Location: Suite 4, Level 1, 687 Doncaster Road, Doncaster, Victoria 3108, AU
Overview: Doncare has been operating in Melbourne's inner east since 1969 providing support to people experiencing significant economic and social disadvantage in the community. Doncare provides personalised support services including counselling; family services; social support; child mental health assistance; domestic violence support; crisis management and volunteering programs. Doncare has established a reputation for connecting people in the community. The philosophy "by the community, for the community"​ remains true to Doncare's core business of strengthening, and supporting the local community through helping people overcome adversity and to the ethos of volunteering.  Volunteerism makes it possible for Doncare to deliver the range of support services.  Family Services work intensively with families in partnership with Child Protection to promote child safety, development and permanency and to increase parenting capacity and improve family functioning.  Community Support Workers provide financial and material assistance to families experiencing emotional or economic hardship. DAWN provides long-term support to women recovering from the ramifications of domestic violence through a mentoring process, where volunteers are matched with a client. The program’s focus is to improve the safety, confidence, and community connectedness of abused women. The Social Support for Seniors program provides volunteer supported social and recreational outings.   The Community Visitors Scheme plays a vital role in providing companionship for older people who are experiencing loneliness or isolation living in Residential Aged Care Homes or in their own homes and receiving a Commonwealth Aged Care Package.  Doncare operates seven opportunity shops in the cities of Manningham and Whitehorse, as well as an online store that raise substantial funds for Doncare programs.
Address_0: Manningham City Square, suite 4 level 1/687 Doncaster Rd, Doncaster VIC 3108, Australia

Name: Lentara UnitingCare
Overview:
Lentara UnitingCare is an agency of the Uniting Church in Australia, serving the people of the
North and West of Melbourne.

UnitingCare Sunshine and Broadmeadows originally evolved from two Missions which
had their roots in the former Methodist Church: Broadmeadows Parish Mission and Sunshine
Parish Mission.

Orana UnitingCare in Meadow Heights, a community service agency of the Uniting Church,
was founded in 1888 as the Central Dorcas Help and Rescue Society, part of the Wesleyan Home
Missions in Victoria. In 2012 the two agencies joined to form Lentara UnitingCare.

The Uniting Church established the Hotham Mission Asylum Seeker Project (ASP) in 1997 to
help asylum seekers who faced destitution while living lawfully in the community and awaiting an
outcome on their refugee claim. In 2013 the ASP was transferred to Lentara UnitingCare.

At Lentara UnitingCare we:
- affirm cultural diversity
- show compassion for the vulnerable
- encourage people to value and use their strengths
- advocate on behalf of those who are disadvantaged
- challenge inequity and injustice and work for social change.

We support some of the most vulnerable people to access the resources they need for health,
wellbeing and participation in the community. The services of Lentara UnitingCare are provided
to all people irrespective of cultural background, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion or disability.

Name: Community Restorative Centre
Overview: The Community Restorative Centre (CRC) provides a range of services to people involved in the criminal justice system and their families. CRC is the lead provider of specialist through-care, post-release, and reintegration programs for people transitioning from prison into the community in NSW. All CRC programs aim to reduce crime and break entrenched cycles of disadvantage, offending and imprisonment.

Name: Centacare North Queensland (NQ)

Name: Youth Activating Youth
Overview: YAY is non-profit organisation that strives address the psycho-social needs of multicultural youth. We provide marginalized young people that have become estranged from their respective communities the necessary tools to reengage with available services. The services we offer aim to bridge the gaps that currently exists between different government organisations, non-profit agencies and other services providers, especially where multicultural youth are concerned. Positive feedback from our current programs has spurred us explore and invest into employment and education, sports and recreation, and arts and culture.Our programs provide the necessary tools for disadvantaged and disengaged young people to build self-confidence, self-efficacy, and networks that will encourage a more enduring development. This will benefit their communities, and Australia as a country.Youth Activating Youth is a youth-led action research/community development group aimed to:- Gather the needs of young people from CALD backgrounds through youth consultations- Involve young people in the design, implementation and evaluation of programs, forums, conferences, workshops and all other facets of running a successful non-for-profit organization- Implement innovative strategies by young people for young people involving health and wellbeing, education and training and community participation- Use fun activities as tools for youth engagement, social inclusion and leadership development- YAY programs support vulnerable young people including those disengaged from school, family and community or at risk of engaging in antisocial behaviour aged 15-24.

Amaze is the peak organisation for Autism in Victoria, Australia. We provide a range of services to individuals/families/carers and professionals with a link to autism.

Company Overview

Amaze carries out many activities:
 
•  Practical support, advice and information to individuals, parents and families who have had a diagnosis of autism

Name: Disability Connect Victoria
Overview: Disability Connect Victoria is a registered NDIS, TAC & WorkSafe provider. Name: DSF Literacy and Clinical Services
Overview:
DSF Literacy and Clinical Services (The Dyslexia-SPELD Foundation of WA inc.) has provided vital support to West Australian children and adults with learning disabilities for over 40 years. It remains committed to improving the level of support provided to children and adults with learning disabilities and to the community’s understanding of specific learning disabilities, in particular dyslexia.

DSF continues to focus on ensuring that children and adults with learning disabilities are supported adequately and appropriately, and that all students are provided with the opportunity to achieve their potential. In addition it provides advice and support to families and educators on successful literacy acquisition, evidence-based practice, and the strategies most likely to improve literacy outcomes for all students. Our role includes supporting and advising students, adults and families directly, as well as indirectly through the support and advice provided at a school or employment level.

Name: Karinya House for Mothers & Babies
Overview: Karinya House Home for Mothers & Babies Inc. is a community based, not-for-profit organisation. Our purpose is providing supported accommodation, transitional housing, outreach services and support groups to pregnant and parenting women and their families who are in crisis. Our service, which operates on a twenty-four hour, seven days a week basis, is located in the ACT and provides professional and specialised support to women throughout Canberra and the surrounding regional areas. Since the establishment of Karinya House in late 1997 through to 30 June 2016, we have provided residential and outreach support to over 5,000 pregnant and parenting women.

Name: Olivia's Place
Overview: Situated in Warragul, in the Baw Baw Shire, Olivia's Place provides practical supports and resources to families experiencing periods of vulnerability during any stage of pregnancy and early parenting up to the youngest child's 1st birthday.A registered charity governed by an independent board of nine local mums and dads with relevant experience and qualifications, families access support locally and from the greater Gippsland region.Staffed by a small constituent of paid staff, the organisation is predominantly run on volunteer power with over 35 volunteers active at any one time.  Olivia's Place always welcomes further volunteerism across multiple facets of organisational administration and service delivery.Impacts for families (mums, dads and babies alike) include:- improved social connection and network- enhanced accessibility to supportive services and programs- emotional support- early recognition and referral for perinatal mental health adversities- early identification of risk factors related to family violence- provision of expensive and much-needed material aid for parents and babiesServices of Olivia's Place are in high demand and are all provided free of charge.
